definition: (psychology) modifying the natural expression of an impulse or instinct (especially a sexual one) to one that is socially acceptable
details:
noun
- (psychology) modifying the natural expression of an impulse or instinct (especially a sexual one) to one that is socially acceptable
- in chemistry, a change directly from the solid to the gaseous state without becoming liquid
= example: in chemistry, a change directly from the solid to the gaseous state without becoming liquid
